definition[0]: (individual retirement account) /ˈaɪrə/ a special bank account in which people living in the US can save money for their retirement without paying tax on it until later
definition[1]: individual retirement account; a savings account which a SELF-EMPLOYED person or someone working for a company can open if their employer does not offer a PENSION PLAN
example[0]: A 35-year-old with $15,000 in IRA accounts would be eligible to withdraw about $453 a year.
